alert.note: Alert for Calumet; Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 3:42PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Calumet and southwestern Manitowoc Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 341 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chilton, or 15 miles east of Oshkosh, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Chilton around 350 PM CDT. St Anna around 355 PM CDT. St. Nazianz and Camp Rokilio Scout Camp around 415 PM CDT. Valders around 420 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Louis Corners, Brant, St Nazianz, Killsnake Wildlife Area, Quinney, Jericho, Kiel, Millhome, Kloten and New Holstein. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
